You are free to insert HTML anywhere in the # page below the last --- separator. Follow the guidelines in each section # to fill in the details of your event. You can look at other past event pages # for examples of different ways to set them up. Note that this website # structure was adopted after several event pages were already in place. Some # events have only been partially converted to this new format. # # To see built example of this starter page, see: # http://testthewebforward.org/events/events/kits/resources/site/page-template-en.html # # See the final steps for previewing and sending the pull request. You # may add as many items as you need here. # # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ location: venue: "New Relic, Portland" link: "http://newrelic.com/about/contact-us" address: ["111 SW 5th Ave #2800", "Portland, OR, 97204"] # ------------------------------ FOCUS SPECS ----------------------------------- # focus_specs: OPTIONAL # # If you'll be highlighting certain specs at your event, they can be # include the Requirements section of the page. # # Example: # HTML5: # "HTML5 Forms" : "http://www.w3.org/TR/html5/forms.html" # CSS: # "CSS Basic User Interface": "http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-ui/" # "CSS Shapes": "http://www.w3.org/TR/css-shapes/" # "CSS Masking": "http://www.w3.org/TR/css-masking/" # FXTF: # "Compositing & Blending": "http://dev.w3.org/fxtf/compositing-1/" # Browser and Testing Tools: # "WebDriver": "http://www.w3.org/TR/webdriver/" # Accessibility: # "Accessibility Testing": "/docs/test-a11y.html" # # For a live example of how the focus specs appear in the Requirements # section, see: # http://testthewebforward.org/events/2013/shenzhen.html#requirements # # Note: The live example is bilingual. For this English-only template, # the focus specs will only appear once in English. # # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ focus_specs: CSP: "Content Security Policy" : "http://www.w3.org/TR/CSP" ---

About

If you live in the Portland area, are coming to town for CascadiaJS 2014 and Dev Week PDX, or just fancy a visit to the beautiful Rose City, come join us Sunday, August 3rd for Test the Web Forward Portland 2014.

Serious front-end developers know that security is not just for server-side code anymore. Come learn how Content Security Policy works to help stop XSS in your apps from expert Ian Melven of New Relic, who contributed to the implementation for Mozilla Firefox. Then learn to write tests that will help you explore CSP, make it better and more interoperable, and perhaps even find a bypass we haven't thought of yet. {% include events/schedule.html schedule=page.schedule %} {% include events/speakers.html speakers=page.speakers %} {% include events/experts.html experts=page.experts %} {% include events/location.html map_link="" map_embed="https://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=111+SW+5th+Avenue,+Suite+2800+Portland,+OR+97204&aq=&sll=37.791442,-122.392723&sspn=0.0068,0.010386&ie=UTF8&hq=&hnear=111+SW+5th+Ave+%232800,+Portland,+Multnomah,+Oregon+97204&t=m&ll=45.528479,-122.674627&spn=0.022849,0.054846&z=14&iwloc=A&output=embed" %} {% include events/requirements.html %} If you want to write tests for CSP, you should also either install PHP and Apache on your local system, or have an SSH client and public key so we can give you access to a preconfigured test server. {% include events/sponsors.html %}
